meanings.definition: The quality or state of being stodgy or dull in character or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The stodginesses of the old library made it feel unwelcoming.
meanings.sent2: Her outfit lacked style, showing a hint of stodginesses.
meanings.sent3: The stodginesses of the party was evident when everyone left early.
meanings.sent4: The stodginesses of the meeting sucked the energy out of the room.
meanings.sent5: The stodginesses of the museum exhibit bored the visitors to tears.

meanings.definition: The tendency to be overly formal or conservative in behavior or thinking.
meanings.sent1: His stodginesses in following rules made him unpopular among his peers.
meanings.sent2: The company's stodginesses prevented them from adapting to new trends.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's stodginesses about technology always lead to funny misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: The stodginesses of tradition weighed heavily on the family's decisions.
meanings.sent5: Her stodginesses in opinions made her seem out of touch with modern times.
